metadata.title: CVE-2021-20294 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in binutils readelf 2.35 program. An attacker who is able to convince a victim using readelf to read a crafted file could trigger a stack buffer overflow, out-of-bounds write of arbitrary data supplied by the attacker. The highest impact of this flaw is to confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-20294` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-common - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-for-build - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-for-host - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-multiarch - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-source - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
libbinutils - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
libctf0 - 2.36.1-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.36.1-6ubuntu1').
